reviews.review_msg: Not so good prof. talks really fast. would help if his lectures are recorded. Marks very hard.. NOT recommended..

Lecture slides are PACKED. It's distracting during lecture but really helpful for review later. Lectures also taped. Great lectures, great insight. My grade was lousy but the entire grade was tests and I don't test well, I'm better at written assignments. If you test well this class is good for you. Good texts and supplementary materials.

Lectures are long, however if you don't want to go, he posts recordings and slides on canvas! Tests are fairly straight forward, but there is a lot to study. Probably wouldn't take again, but he isn't a terrible prof.

Dr. Maxwell well if my major ain't archaeology, I wouldn't take his lecture, period. Super long slides (average 80 pages per slide) I understand there is a lot to cover, but the sequence is very confusing. I have to go back and forth to re-organize my notes before the exam. Want good grade? Study for it, I mean STUDY STUDY STUDY.  A LOT OF NOTES!

Rudy is an amazing person, but he is also extremely chaotic and disorganized. He cancels lectures, forgets to put in all the assignments to canvas (like midterms), and as a result, you are missing the grade. However, he is very caring as well. With a good TA it all might work, but his lectures still need more structure.

Rudy, his lectures and the content and course work are great, but he cancels class often, sometimes less than an hour before class. He sometimes neglects to add marks into canvas, so your grade ends up lower because your assignments may be 'missing' (this is bad when there are only 3 assignments) and he is IMPOSSIBLE to get ahold of.

There was a LOT reading. Probably could have got away with not doing some of it, but the assigned papers were relevant. Lecture was a bit disorganized, but interesting overall. Tutorial got cancelled a lot, which wasn't anyone's fault but it was frustrating. I'd recommend to anyone interested in archaeology or in Indigenous history.

One of my absolute favourite professors in the Archaeology program. He cares about local archaeology and introduces his class to some of the current field work. He provides large amounts of interesting First Nations background information. Always willing to talk during after class or during office hours, 100% would take again.

Dr. Rudy is a great guy and lectures are really informative and interesting. It's too bad the class wasn't better organized, communication was lacking and expectations for assignments weren't at all clear (even before the class moved online). The midterm questions were so confusing. Do your readings and know the content really well for exams.

Rudy is one of the absolute best lecturers I've ever had. He's so engaging and so passionate about this course content. If you need to take arch273 take it with Rudy! The exams and paper are pretty straightforward and the grading is very fair

RUDY IS AWESOME!!!! he is so nice and his course material is interesting and very organized. he puts a lot of effort into his lectures and material. this is a prof who genuinely cares and makes school worthwhile
